intro: Onopordum acanthium var. schultesii, commonly known as the Schultes' thistle, is a perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and yellow composite flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is well adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Due to its hardy nature, it is often used in xeriscaping and as a ornamental plant in gardens.
